tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.title: Analytical analysis of the mechanical and hydrological effects of vegetation on shallow slope stability
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2020
#leer
Feng, S., Liu, H. W., & Ng, C. W. W. (2020). Analytical analysis of the mechanical and hydrological effects of vegetation on shallow slope stability. Computers and Geotechnics, 118, 103335. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compgeo.2019.103335 Vegetaci√≥n y estabilidad de taludes Efecto hidrol√≥gico de ra√≠ces Refuerzo mec√°nico radicular Succi√≥n del suelo Soluciones anal√≠ticas Estabilidad de taludes no saturados El art√≠culo de Feng, Liu y Ng (2020) propone soluciones anal√≠ticas que integran los efectos hidrol√≥gicos y mec√°nicos de la vegetaci√≥n en la estabilidad de taludes poco profundos. Se modelan distintos tipos de arquitectura radicular (uniforme y exponencial), mostrando que las ra√≠ces no solo refuerzan mec√°nicamente el suelo (aumentando la cohesi√≥n aparente), sino que tambi√©n generan efectos hidrol√≥gicos significativos al modificar la succi√≥n y la presi√≥n de poros. El estudio concluye que: El efecto hidrol√≥gico es dominante en condiciones de secado, particularmente en pendientes suaves. El efecto mec√°nico predomina despu√©s de la lluvia y en pendientes m√°s empinadas. La resistencia a la tracci√≥n de las ra√≠ces y la tasa de transpiraci√≥n son factores cr√≠ticos en la magnitud de ambos efectos. Tras eventos de lluvia intensa (per√≠odo de retorno de 10 a√±os), el efecto hidrol√≥gico se reduce dr√°sticamente, quedando el mec√°nico como determinante. ‚ÄúAnalytical solutions are proposed considering the hydrological and mechanical effects of roots with different root architectures on shallow slope stability.‚Äù ‚ÄúAt drying conditions, the hydrological effect becomes more significant in gentler slopes, while the opposite is true for the mechanical effect. After rainfall (with a 10-year return period), the hydrological effect vanishes almost entirely, and hence the mechanical effect dominates slope stability.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe hydrological effect refers to the reduction in pore-water pressure (PWP) through root water uptake, leading to a reduction in soil hydraulic conductivity but an increase in soil shear strength. The mechanical effect refers to the enhanced soil shear strength attributed to the mechanical reinforcement of roots.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe hydrological and mechanical effects of roots are more significant in the slope reinforced by the exponential root branching system than in the one reinforced by the uniform root branching system.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.title: Analytical solution for coupled hydro-mechanical modeling of infiltration in unsaturated soils
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2022
#leer --> Importante
Tracy, F. T., & Vahedifard, F. (2022). Analytical solution for coupled hydro-mechanical modeling of infiltration in unsaturated soils. Journal of Hydrology, 612, 128198. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jhydrol.2022.128198Unsaturated soil; Infiltration; Hydro-mechanical coupling; Analytical solution; Slope stability; Groundwater modeling.Este art√≠culo propone una soluci√≥n anal√≠tica novedosa para modelar la infiltraci√≥n en suelos no saturados incorporando expl√≠citamente el acoplamiento hidromec√°nico (interacci√≥n entre flujo de agua y deformaci√≥n del suelo). Los autores desarrollan dos problemas: Infiltraci√≥n aplicada como carga hidr√°ulica constante en la superficie. Infiltraci√≥n aplicada como flujo constante en la superficie. El modelo integra: Principio de esfuerzos efectivos de Bishop. Variaci√≥n del m√≥dulo de Young con la succi√≥n. Curvas caracter√≠sticas de retenci√≥n e hidr√°ulicas basadas en Gardner. Los resultados muestran que: El acoplamiento hidromec√°nico genera diferencias significativas (hasta 40%) en comparaci√≥n con soluciones desacopladas. Propiedades como conductividad hidr√°ulica saturada (ks), par√°metro Œ± de Gardner y m√≥dulo de Young afectan fuertemente la distribuci√≥n de presiones y deformaciones. El m√©todo puede usarse como benchmark para validar m√©todos num√©ricos (ej. elementos finitos) y se puede aplicar en estabilidad de taludes, presi√≥n lateral de tierras, capacidad portante y mapeo regional de deslizamientos. ‚ÄúThe infiltration problem inherently possesses a coupled hydro-mechanical problem in which the unsaturated flow and the soil deformation interact and affect each other.‚Äù _‚ÄúResults reveal that the coupling effect can be pronounced for various values of saturated hydraulic conductivity, Gardner‚Äôs Œ± parameter, and Young‚Äôs Modulus.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe solution can be readily incorporated into site-specific (e.g., groundwater modeling, slope stability) or regional-scale (e.g., landslide mapping) analyses of unsaturated natural and man-made slopes and earthen structures subject to infiltration.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe presented analytical framework offers a benchmark for the validation of numerical methods.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2010
#leer
Baum, R. L., Godt, J. W., & Savage, W. Z. (2010). Estimating the timing and location of shallow rainfall‚Äêinduced landslides using a model for transient, unsaturated infiltration. Journal of Geophysical Research: Earth Surface, 115(F03013). https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JF001321Shallow landslides; Transient infiltration; TRIGRS model; GIS; Unsaturated soils.Este trabajo desarrolla y aplica el modelo TRIGRS para predecir la ubicaci√≥n y el tiempo de inicio de deslizamientos superficiales inducidos por lluvia. El modelo combina soluciones anal√≠ticas de infiltraci√≥n transitoria en suelos no saturados con an√°lisis de estabilidad de taludes infinitos, implementado en un entorno SIG. Aplicado en Seattle, logr√≥ reproducir con buena precisi√≥n la distribuci√≥n y el momento de ocurrencia de deslizamientos registrados durante tormentas. ‚ÄúWe developed a model of the infiltration process using a two-layer system that consists of an unsaturated zone above a saturated zone and implemented this model in a GIS framework.‚Äù ‚ÄúPore pressures computed by these coupled models are subsequently used in one-dimensional slope-stability computations to estimate the timing and locations of slope failures.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe unsaturated layer attenuates and delays the rainfall-induced pore-pressure response, resulting in realistic estimates of timing for the onset of slope instability.‚Äù

El trabajo enfatiza que la combinaci√≥n de altas pendientes, lluvias intensas y p√©rdida de vegetaci√≥n es determinante en la generaci√≥n de procesos de remoci√≥n en masa.Citas textuales √∫tiles ‚ÄúWildfire was shown to alter soil hydraulic properties, producing reduced infiltration and increased runoff that contributed to debris flow initiation.‚Äù ‚ÄúHigh burn severity areas exhibited significantly higher post-fire runoff coefficients.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe occurrence of debris flows was strongly linked to short duration, high-intensity rainfall events on steep, severely burned slopes.‚Äù

Engineering Geology, 335, 107538. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.enggeo.2024.107538Hydromechanical modeling; Post-wildfire landslides; Susceptibility mapping; GIS; Root reinforcement; Rainfall.Este estudio propone un marco f√≠sico acoplado hidromec√°nico para generar mapas de susceptibilidad a deslizamientos regionales post-incendio, integrando modelos de flujo no saturado, refuerzo de ra√≠ces y estabilidad de taludes infinitos dentro de un sistema GIS. El modelo mostr√≥ que los incendios duplicaron el √°rea inestable en comparaci√≥n con escenarios sin fuego. ‚ÄúA coupled hydromechanical model considering unsaturated flow and root reinforcement is integrated into an infinite slope stability model to simulate the triggering of shallow landslides from rainfall.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe proposed framework was tested in the San Gabriel Complex Fire area‚Ä¶ successfully capturing both the timing and spatial distribution of shallow landslides.‚Äù ‚ÄúCompared to the no-fire scenario, wildfire could double the number of unstable zones within the affected area.‚Äù

#leer

Earth and Space Science, 11(2), e2023EA003817. https://doi.org/10.1029/2023EA003817Wildfire effects; Soil properties; Hydromechanical response; Unsaturated slopes; Post-fire landslides.Este art√≠culo revisa y sintetiza las interdependencias entre los cambios inducidos por incendios en las propiedades del suelo y su relaci√≥n con la estabilidad de laderas. Se destacan procesos como: Hidrofobicidad, que reduce la infiltraci√≥n inicial y aumenta la escorrent√≠a. P√©rdida de ra√≠ces y reducci√≥n de la transpiraci√≥n, que disminuyen la cohesi√≥n y la succi√≥n. Alteraci√≥n de propiedades hidr√°ulicas y mec√°nicas que favorecen deslizamientos tras lluvias. Se resalta que la recuperaci√≥n post-fuego es altamente variable y depende de clima, severidad de quema y cobertura vegetal. ‚ÄúWildfire alters both mechanical and hydrological responses of the soil, predisposing slopes to shallow failures under rainfall.‚Äù ‚ÄúLoss of root reinforcement and reduction in transpiration are key drivers of post-fire slope instability.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe recovery of soil hydraulic properties after fire is neither immediate nor uniform, and this temporal variability strongly controls landslide susceptibility.‚Äù

#Articulo

Yin, J., Li, J., Tang, C., Wang, Y., Wang, H., & Catani, F. (2020). Evaluation and prediction of post-wildfire landslide susceptibility using machine learning approaches. Scientific Reports, 10, 12055. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-020-69233-2Post-wildfire landslides; Machine learning; Susceptibility mapping; Random Forest; China.Este estudio aplic√≥ m√©todos de machine learning (Random Forest, SVM, ANN) para mapear la susceptibilidad a deslizamientos tras incendios en Sichuan, China. Con un inventario de deslizamientos post-incendio y m√∫ltiples variables (pendiente, litolog√≠a, uso del suelo, NDVI, precipitaci√≥n), se compar√≥ el desempe√±o de los modelos. El Random Forest obtuvo la mejor precisi√≥n (AUC > 0.9). Los resultados evidencian que la p√©rdida de cobertura vegetal por incendios incrementa fuertemente la susceptibilidad a deslizamientos superficiales en terrenos monta√±osos. ‚ÄúWildfires destroy vegetation and induce soil hydrophobicity, leading to increased landslide susceptibility under rainfall conditions.‚Äù ‚ÄúAmong the models tested, the Random Forest algorithm achieved the highest predictive capability (AUC > 0.90).‚Äù ‚ÄúThe landslide susceptibility in burned areas is significantly higher than in unburned terrain with similar geo-environmental conditions.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.title: Landslide susceptibility assessment of wildfire burnt areas through Earth-observation techniques and a machine learning-based approach
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2020
#leer
Di Napoli, M., Marsiglia, P., Di Martire, D., Ramondini, M., Ullo, S. L., & Calcaterra, D. (2020). Landslide susceptibility assessment of wildfire burnt areas through Earth-observation techniques and a machine learning-based approach. Remote Sensing, 12(15), 2505. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs12152505 Wildfire Landslide susceptibility Remote sensing Machine learning Naples municipality Post-fire instability El art√≠culo aborda la evaluaci√≥n de la susceptibilidad a deslizamientos en √°reas afectadas por incendios forestales mediante el uso de teledetecci√≥n satelital (Landsat, Sentinel-2) y t√©cnicas de machine learning (ANN, GBM, RF y MaxEnt). El √°rea de estudio fueron las colinas de Camaldoli y Agnano (N√°poles, Italia), muy afectadas por incendios recurrentes. Se gener√≥ un inventario de m√°s de 1300 deslizamientos (1816‚Äì2020), y se evaluaron 11 factores predisponentes (pendiente, curvatura, litolog√≠a, uso del suelo, TWI, TPI, densidad de drenaje, distancia a cauces, entre otros, incluyendo incendios). Los resultados muestran que: El √°ngulo de pendiente y la litolog√≠a son los factores m√°s influyentes. Los incendios aumentan significativamente la probabilidad de inestabilidad en comparaci√≥n con mapas ‚Äúbase‚Äù sin este factor. Las √°reas con incendios recientes mostraron una fuerte migraci√≥n de deslizamientos hacia clases de alta y muy alta susceptibilidad. El modelo alcanz√≥ un alto rendimiento (AUC > 0.95, TSS > 0.79). Concluyen que integrar incendios como variable en modelos de susceptibilidad es crucial para planificaci√≥n urbana y gesti√≥n del riesgo en territorios densamente poblados. ‚ÄúWildfires can produce radical variations in the runoff response of a burnt watershed‚Ä¶ infiltration generally decreases because the chemical and physical properties of the soil may have changed, making the soil more water repellent.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt can, therefore, be said that this study allowed us to demonstrate quantitatively how the variable ‚Äòwildfires‚Äô increase the propensity to trigger the phenomena considered.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe landslide susceptibility maps obtained from the ensemble method provide evidence that the largest part of the study area has very low and low susceptibility‚Ä¶ however, most of the landslides surveyed fall within the highest susceptibility class value.‚Äù ‚ÄúConsequently, the maps drawn up in 1997, 2001, and 2019 could be considered in terms of hazard, being characterized by a time limit‚Ä¶ intended as a support for more effective territory management.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.title: Physics-based modeling of post-wildfire landslides in unsaturated soils
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Tesis
#a√±o2024
#leer
#core
Zhang, L., Wang, X., & Huang, J. (2024). Physics-based modeling of post-wildfire landslides in unsaturated soils. Computers and Geotechnics, 171, 106186. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compgeo.2024.106186Post-wildfire landslides; Unsaturated soils; Physics-based modeling; Infiltration; Root reinforcement; Factor of safety.Este art√≠culo desarrolla un modelo f√≠sico acoplado para simular la inestabilidad de taludes post-incendio en suelos no saturados, integrando: Infiltraci√≥n transitoria basada en ecuaciones de Richards. P√©rdida de refuerzo radicular y disminuci√≥n de la transpiraci√≥n tras incendios. Variaciones en la curva caracter√≠stica de retenci√≥n de agua (SWRC) debido a la quema. El modelo permite calcular la evoluci√≥n del factor de seguridad (FS) bajo diferentes escenarios de severidad de quema y eventos de lluvia. Resultados clave: El FS disminuye significativamente en suelos quemados, con reducciones de hasta 30% bajo lluvias intensas. La interacci√≥n entre p√©rdida de ra√≠ces y cambios hidrol√≥gicos es cr√≠tica para explicar la inestabilidad. Validado con datos de campo, el modelo reprodujo adecuadamente la ocurrencia de deslizamientos superficiales en √°reas quemadas. ‚ÄúA physics-based framework is developed to investigate the combined hydrological and mechanical effects of wildfire on shallow slope stability in unsaturated soils.‚Äù ‚ÄúWildfire reduces the factor of safety of slopes by decreasing root reinforcement, reducing transpiration, and altering soil-water retention properties.‚Äù ‚ÄúFor the simulated cases, wildfire could decrease the factor of safety by up to 30% under intense rainfall conditions.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe model successfully captured the timing and distribution of shallow landslides observed in the field after wildfire.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#A√±o2018
#leer Palabras clave Debris flows, stochastic modeling, INLA, log-Gaussian Cox process, Bayesian inference, Messina disaster.Referencia:
Lombardo, L., Opitz, T., & Huser, R. (2018). Point process-based modeling of multiple debris flow landslides using INLA: An application to the 2009 Messina disaster. Stochastic Environmental Research and Risk Assessment, 32(8), 2179‚Äì2198. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00477-018-1518-0Resumen Este art√≠culo presenta un enfoque estad√≠stico innovador para modelar deslizamientos por flujo de detritos mediante procesos puntuales log-Gaussian Cox e inferencia bayesiana con INLA. Aplicado al desastre de Messina (2009), se modelan simult√°neamente susceptibilidad y intensidad de ocurrencia de deslizamientos, integrando covariables geomorfol√≥gicas y efectos espaciales latentes. Los resultados muestran alta precisi√≥n predictiva, destacando la importancia de los factores espaciales no observados, como patrones de lluvia.Citas textuales √∫tiles ‚ÄúWe develop a stochastic modeling approach based on spatial point processes of log-Gaussian Cox type for a collection of around 5000 landslide events provoked by a precipitation trigger‚Äù. ‚ÄúOur novel approach features a spatial latent effect defined at the slope unit level, allowing us to assess the spatial influence that remains unexplained by the covariates in the model‚Äù. ‚ÄúPredicting this landslide intensity provides more detailed and complete information as compared to the classically used susceptibility mapping approach‚Äù.

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.title: Post Wildifire Stability of Unsaturated Hillslopes Against Rainfall-Triggerred Landslides
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/estabilid.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2023
Abdollahi, M., Vahedifard, F., & Tracy, F. T. (2023). Post-wildfire stability of unsaturated hillslopes against rainfall-triggered landslides. Earth‚Äôs Future, 11(3), e2022EF003213. https://doi.org/10.1029/2022EF003213Post-wildfire slopes, unsaturated soil, rainfall-triggered landslides, hydromechanical infiltration, infinite slope model, factor of safety, burn severity. ‚ÄúWe developed a new physics-based analytical framework incorporating wildfire-induced changes in soil properties and near-surface processes affecting the hillslope stability‚Äù ‚ÄúA coupled hydromechanical infiltration model is integrated into an infinite slope stability analysis to simulate temporal changes in the depth profiles of soil water content, pressure head, and the resulting factor of safety (F.S.)‚Äù ‚ÄúFor the cases examined, it was shown that wildfire could reduce the F.S. of slopes by 25%‚Äù ‚ÄúAs a case study, the model successfully captured shallow rainfall-triggered landslides that occurred in the Las Lomas watershed in California, USA, in 2019, 3 years after the Fish Fire burned the area‚Äù ‚ÄúWildfires can significantly lower the hillslope stability to rainfall-triggered shallow landslides‚Äù Severidad de quema: (baja, moderada, alta) ‚Üí afecta transpiraci√≥n y refuerzo radicular. #Articulo

Water Resources Research, 49(12), 8090‚Äì8107. https://doi.org/10.1002/2013WR014129 Hidrolog√≠a post-incendio Flujo no saturado Hydrus-1D Estabilidad de taludes Evapotranspiraci√≥n Infiltraci√≥n Aspecto de ladera (norte/sur) Recarga subterr√°ne Ebel (2013) realiza experimentos virtuales con el modelo Hydrus-1D para simular procesos de flujo no saturado despu√©s de un incendio en laderas con diferentes orientaciones (norte y sur) en Colorado, EE. UU. El estudio destaca que la p√©rdida de vegetaci√≥n, hojarasca y capa org√°nica modifica la infiltraci√≥n, la evaporaci√≥n y la recarga subterr√°nea. Los experimentos mostraron que la recarga subterr√°nea aument√≥ hasta 12 veces en suelos quemados. ‚ÄúWildfire profoundly impacts the landscape, changing rates, and relative partitioning between interception, evapotranspiration, infiltration, runoff, subsurface storage, and deep percolation‚Äù ‚ÄúThe numerical model virtual experiments showed that loss of transpiration because of vegetation combustion/mortality caused soils to be wetter at depths greater than 5 cm on both north and south facing slopes‚Äù ‚ÄúSimulated bottom boundary flux, a proxy for groundwater recharge, was greater in north facing burned plots by a factor of 3.5‚Äì5.2 and greater on south facing plots by a factor of 10.6‚Äì12.7, relative to unburned plots‚Äù ‚ÄúDeterministic hydrologic simulations allow carefully manipulated ‚Äòvirtual experiments‚Äô and can provide a way forward‚Äù ‚ÄúMost postwildfire hydrologic modeling studies focus on infiltration-excess runoff generation and event-scale hydrologic response‚Ä¶ shifts in near-surface hydrologic processes after wildfire that alter how catchments take in, store, and release water require more thorough understanding‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/metodos-p.title: M√©todos probabil√≠sticos
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/metodos-p.description:
Dada la naturaleza de los par√°metros del suelo, es necesario usar m√©todos estad√≠sticos para la determinaci√≥n del factor de seguridad. En el articulo Probabilistic analysis in slope stability se menciona Ground strength parameters are considered as random variables following truncated normal distribution. Cohesion and friction angle are considered to be statistically uncorrelated. Unit weight, geometrical and support parameters are considered as deterministic variables. A probabilistic analysis is then performed for these slopes using Monte Carlo simulation to determine the probability distribution of the safety factor and the corresponding probability of failure (pf) of the slope (i.e., when the safety factor is less than unity) as a function of the problem parameters.
Adem√°s en el documento de M√©todos Estat√≠sticos e Probabil√≠sticos Aplicados a Geotecnia se dan bases para usar la estad√≠stica en geotecnia y se enlistan distintos m√©todos probabil√≠sticos potenciales a usar.

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/metodos-p.title: Probabilistic analysis in slope stability
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/metodos-p.description:
Tipo de documento: #Articulo Autores: M. Kavvadas, M. Karlaftis, P. Fortsakis, E. Stylianidi
A√±o: #A√±o2009Geotechnical design is, perhaps, the civil engineering subject most dominated by uncertainty. Although partly due to limited field investigations, the main reason of this uncertainty is the highly heterogeneous and anisotropic nature of ground materials. Deterministic design methods as required by design codes, attempt to account for ground uncertainty by adopting conservative values of ground parameters and relatively large safety factors. This paper performs probabilistic analyses of soil slopes using Monte Carlo simulation in order to investigate the effect of these assumptions on the calculated probability of failure of the slopes. For slopes in saturated cohesive materials under undrained conditions an analytical solution is proposed while for drained conditions parametric analyses are performed. It is shown that slopes designed according to Eurocode 7 (EN1997-1) correspond to probabilities of failure up to 12%. Based on the results of these analyses, diagrams are proposed for the estimation of the probability of failure as a function of the geometrical, geotechnical and support parameters of the slope.

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Effect of temperature on some geotechnical properties of a tropical soil
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.description:
Tipo de publicaci√≥n: #Articulo Autores: Juliana Pati√±o, Yamile Valencia, Oscar Echeverri, Maria Camila Alvarez
#A√±o2014 Objeto del articulo En esta investigaci√≥n se estudia la variaci√≥n de ciertas propiedades geot√©cnicas de un suelo tropical expuesto a altas temperaturas, para determinar las diferencias existentes entre dichas propiedades y las del suelo sin exposici√≥n; obteniendo como resultado, cambios en propiedades mec√°nicas que hacen el material menos resistente. Zona de estudio La zona de estudio est√° ubicada al noroccidente del municipio de Medell√≠n en La Facultad de Minas de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia, en los alrededores del bloque M8, con coordenadas 6¬∞16¬¥30.31¬¥¬¥N - 75¬∞35¬¥32.87¬¥¬¥O y con una altitud de 1554 m.s.n.m. (figura 1). Su temperatura media anual es de 24¬∞ C y su precipitaci√≥n promedio anual es de 1571 mm (Municipio de Medell√≠n, 2006). Material Evaluado Los flujos de lodo se encuentran por encima de los flujos de detritos y se distinguen por su color amarillento y gris, b√°sicamente el material encontrado es fino granular y su matriz est√° compuesta principalmente por limos (MH o ML) llegando a ser arcillosa o arenosa (CL o SM). (Cimientos Ltda Ingenieros Consultores, 2012). Conclusiones En esta investigaci√≥n se encontraron las siguientes conclusiones El suelo en estudio luego de ser sometido a 1000 ¬∞C, temperatura m√°xima de un incendio forestal, present√≥ grandes variaciones respecto a su composici√≥n estructural y qu√≠mica, puesto que se acidific√≥, aument√≥ su gravedad espec√≠fica, se agreg√≥ generando una mayor relaci√≥n de vac√≠os y disminuyendo su succi√≥n por la generaci√≥n de macroporos. Es com√∫n encontrar terrenos recientemente incendiados con rasgos de inestabilidad; el presente estudio nos muestra que las altas temperaturas afectan considerablemente los suelos transformando su estructura en una estructura m√°s abierta, disminuyendo as√≠ la succi√≥n del material y alertando al ingeniero frente al posible comportamiento mec√°nico del mismo, ya que el suelo puede tornarse menos resistente y m√°s susceptible, por ejemplo, a procesos de erosi√≥n superficial. Es importante que se tengan en cuenta muchas otras variables a la hora de estudiar los suelos afectados por el fuego, ya que la duraci√≥n del incendio, el tiempo de ignici√≥n y la cantidad de material expuesto son variables que deben estudiarse con mayor profundidad.

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Hydrologic and erosion responses to compaction and added surface cover in post-fire logged areas Isolating splash, interrill and rill erosion

#Articulo Incendios forestales; Compactaci√≥n; Mulching; Hidrolog√≠a post-incendio; Salpicadura; Sheetwash; Rill erosion.Este trabajo analiza los efectos de la compactaci√≥n del suelo por maquinaria tras incendios forestales y la aplicaci√≥n de coberturas superficiales (mulch y residuos de tala) en procesos de escorrent√≠a y erosi√≥n. La compactaci√≥n aument√≥ el escurrimiento y duplic√≥ las p√©rdidas por salpicadura y sheetwash. El mulch redujo en un 73‚Äì78% la erosi√≥n por salpicadura y hasta en un 95% la erosi√≥n por c√°rcavas (rill erosion). Los residuos de tala (slash) redujeron la salpicadura, pero no la erosi√≥n por sheetwash o c√°rcavas. ‚ÄúSoil compaction during post-fire logging can increase runoff and erosion.‚Äù ‚ÄúMulching significantly reduced rainsplash by 72%, sheetwash by 63%, and rill sediment delivery by 95% as compared to the uncompacted bare soil.‚Äù ‚ÄúSlash cover on the compacted plots also significantly decreased rainsplash erosion by 75%, but had no significant effect on sheetwash or rill sediment delivery.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Landslides after wildfire initiation, magnitude, and mobility
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2020
Rengers, F. K., McGuire, L. A., Oakley, N. S., Kean, J. W., Staley, D. M., & Tang, H. (2020). Landslides after wildfire: initiation, magnitude, and mobility. Landslides, 17(12), 2631‚Äì2641. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10346-020-01506-3Post-wildfire landslides, debris flows, shallow landslides, slope stability, vegetation recovery, burn severity, geomorphology.Resumen del art√≠culo Este estudio analiza 286 deslizamientos ocurridos en las Monta√±as de San Gabriel (California) tras una tormenta en enero de 2019, en √°reas previamente quemadas. Los autores destacan que: Primer a√±o post-incendio: predominan los flujos de escombros generados por escorrent√≠a. Tres a√±os post-incendio: desaparecen los flujos de escombros y surgen deslizamientos superficiales de baja movilidad, asociados a la p√©rdida de refuerzo radicular y la recuperaci√≥n parcial de la infiltraci√≥n. Cinco a√±os post-incendio: la susceptibilidad vuelve a niveles similares a zonas no quemadas. La severidad del fuego y la orientaci√≥n de la pendiente (particularmente laderas empinadas hacia el sur) fueron factores determinantes en la ocurrencia de los deslizamientos. Los resultados evidencian una ventana cr√≠tica de susceptibilidad de 3‚Äì5 a√±os post-incendio, cuando la vegetaci√≥n a√∫n no se ha recuperado del todo. ‚ÄúIn the first year after fire, post-wildfire mass-wasting is dominated by runoff-generated debris flows.‚Äù ‚ÄúThree years after fire, runoff-generated debris flows are largely absent and instead replaced by numerous shallow landslides of low mobility.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe mapped 286 landslides triggered by a January 2019 storm in the San Gabriel Mountains, California.‚Äù ‚ÄúLandslides occurred preferentially in areas burned by moderate- to high-severity wildfire.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe majority (95%) of landslides occurred on steep, south-facing slopes where vegetation recovery is slower.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe density of landslides was greater in areas burned 3 years before the storm, while areas burned 5 years before the storm exhibited landslide densities similar to unburned terrain.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis suggests a temporal window of enhanced landslide susceptibility between about 3 and 5 years post-fire.‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Post-fire geomorphic response in steep, forested landscapes - Oregon Coast Range, USA
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.description:
#Articulo
#A√±o2009
Jackson, M., & Roering, J. J. (2009). Post-fire geomorphic response in steep, forested landscapes: Oregon Coast Range, USA. Quaternary Science Reviews, 28(11‚Äì12), 1131‚Äì1146. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quascirev.2008.05.003Wildfire, hydrophobic soils, dry ravel, slope stability, root reinforcement, shallow landslides, debris flows, Oregon Coast Range.Este trabajo analiza la respuesta geomorfol√≥gica posterior a incendios en tres sitios de la Oregon Coast Range afectados en 1999, 2002 y 2003. Los hallazgos principales son: Los incendios generaron capas hidrof√≥bicas en los suelos, pero debido a discontinuidades naturales se observ√≥ una infiltraci√≥n r√°pida, reduciendo el escurrimiento superficial directo. El proceso dominante inmediatamente despu√©s del fuego fue el ‚Äúdry ravel‚Äù (rodamiento y deslizamiento de clastos sueltos), que contribuy√≥ significativamente al transporte coluvial hacia los valles. Se estim√≥ un descenso promedio del paisaje de 2.5 mm por acumulaci√≥n de ravel en un sitio, lo que implica que los incendios podr√≠an aportar entre 10‚Äì20% de la denudaci√≥n total a largo plazo en √°reas empinadas. Se observ√≥ una r√°pida disminuci√≥n de la resistencia radicular, m√°s r√°pida que la registrada tras la cosecha forestal, lo que sugiere que el calor del fuego da√±√≥ ra√≠ces en el subsuelo poco profundo. El estudio resalta la importancia de la combinaci√≥n entre p√©rdida de refuerzo radicular y aporte de sedimentos por ravel, que incrementan la susceptibilidad a deslizamientos y flujos de escombros en los a√±os posteriores al incendio. ‚ÄúThe role of fire in shaping steep, forested landscapes depends on a suite of hydrologic, biologic, and geological characteristics, including the propensity for hydrophobic soil layers to promote runoff erosion during subsequent rainfall events.‚Äù ‚ÄúFire-driven dry ravel accumulation in low-order valleys of our Sulphur Creek site equated to a slope-averaged landscape lowering of 2.5 mm.‚Äù ‚ÄúGiven Holocene estimates of fire frequency, these results suggest that fire may contribute 10‚Äì20% of total denudation across steep, dissected portions of the Oregon Coast Range.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe documented more rapid decline of root strength at our sites than has been observed after timber harvest, suggesting that root strength was compromised prior to fire or that intense heat damaged roots in the shallow subsurface.‚Äù ‚ÄúOur results suggest that the primary geomorphic consequences of fire in the Oregon Coast Range are dry ravel and root strength decline; we observed sparse evidence for runoff-related erosion at our three study sites.‚Äù ‚ÄúOur three sites demonstrate a progressive post-fire decline in root reinforcement, consistent with the notion that shallow landslides and debris flows become more likely in the years following fire.‚Äù

Canuti (Eds.), Landslides ‚Äì Disaster Risk Reduction (pp. 177‚Äì190). Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-540-69970-5_9Palabras clave Wildfire, debris flows, rainfall thresholds, climate change, hazard assessment, susceptibility models.Resumen Este cap√≠tulo describe c√≥mo el incremento de incendios en el oeste de EE.UU. ha potenciado la ocurrencia de flujos de escombros post-incendio, afectando comunidades urbanas cercanas. Destacan la necesidad de desarrollar herramientas espec√≠ficas para cada contexto clim√°tico y geol√≥gico.Citas textuales √∫tiles ‚ÄúIncreases in the frequency and size of wildfires throughout the western USA can be attributed to increases in the number of fire ignitions, fire suppression practices, and climatic influences‚Äù. ‚ÄúDifferences between rainfall thresholds and empirical debris-flow susceptibility models for southern California and the intermountain west indicate a strong influence of climatic and geologic settings on post-fire debris-flow potential‚Äù. ‚ÄúThe linkages between wildfires, debris-flow occurrence, and global warming suggests that the experiences in the western United States are highly likely to be duplicated in many other parts of the world‚Äù

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Warming enabled upslope advance in western US forest fires
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.description:
#Articulo
#a√±o2021 ‚ÄúWe document an upslope advancement of Z90 by a median of 252 m (95% CI of ‚àí107 to 656 m) during 1984 to 2017 across the mountainous ecoregions of the western United States‚Äù ‚ÄúThe upslope advance of fires is consistent with observed warming reflected by a median upslope drift of VPD isolines of 295 m (59 to 704 m; 95% CI) during 1984 to 2017. These findings allow us to estimate that recent climate trends reduced the high-elevation flammability barrier and enabled fires in an additional 11% of western forests‚Äù ‚ÄúForest fires of the western United States have advanced upslope over the past few decades, scorching territories previously too wet to burn. We document an upslope advancement of high-elevation fires of 7.6 m/y, a rate comparable to the elevational velocity of vapor pressure deficit of 8.9 m/y‚Äù ‚ÄúIncreased high-elevation burned forest is associated with significant implications ranging from biodiversity loss and vegetation conversion to change of snowpack and landscape transformation‚Äù ‚ÄúBy modifying vegetation cover and soil characteristics, fires modify hydrological balance of watersheds. Fires also impact snow accumulation, redistribution, and melt, which are particularly important at high elevations‚Äù ‚ÄúSevere fires can remove standing trees that are anchor points stabilizing snowpack, which together with heavier snowpack due to lower canopy interception enhance the frequency and magnitude of avalanches‚Äù ‚ÄúFires in high-elevation forests are typically associated with return periods of one to multiple centuries. However, we show that high-elevation fires advanced upslope by 252 m (median across 15 ecoregions) during 1984 to 2017‚Äù

#Articulo
#a√±o2020
Ebel, B. A. (2020). Wildfire impacts on soil-water retention in the western USA: Application of a simple thermogravimetric approach for post-fire parameterization. Hydrological Processes, 34(13), 2940‚Äì2956. https://doi.org/10.1002/hyp.13795Soil-water retention, wildfires, hydrophobicity, van Genuchten parameters, soil structure, unsaturated flow, post-fire hydrology.Este estudio propone un m√©todo simple termogravim√©trico para parametrizar curvas de retenci√≥n de agua en suelos post-incendio en diferentes sitios del oeste de EE. UU.Principales hallazgos: Los incendios alteran fuertemente las propiedades de retenci√≥n de agua del suelo, afectando la curva caracter√≠stica de humedad (SWRC). El m√©todo termogravim√©trico demostr√≥ ser eficaz para parametrizar la SWRC post-incendio, simplificando el an√°lisis y facilitando su incorporaci√≥n en modelos hidrol√≥gicos y de estabilidad de taludes. Los resultados muestran que los suelos afectados por fuego presentan menor capacidad de almacenamiento de agua en rangos de succi√≥n intermedia, lo cual incrementa el riesgo de inestabilidad en presencia de lluvias. ‚ÄúWildfire alters soil-water retention properties, which directly impacts infiltration, runoff, and unsaturated flow processes‚Äù ‚ÄúA simple thermogravimetric approach was used to estimate post-fire changes in soil-water retention curves (SWRC) for soils from different burned sites in the western United States‚Äù ‚ÄúWildfire severity and soil type strongly influenced the degree of change in the soil-water retention parameters‚Äù ‚ÄúResults showed systematic decreases in water retention at intermediate suctions, indicating reduced available water capacity in burned soils‚Äù ‚ÄúPost-fire van Genuchten parameters can be incorporated into hydrological and slope stability models to better predict runoff generation and landslide susceptibility‚Äù Expone los efectos de la

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.title: Wildfire probability mapping Bivariate vs. Multivariate statistics
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/quema-de-.description:
Jaafari, A., Mafi-Gholami, D., Pham, B. T., & Bui, D. T. (2019). Wildfire probability mapping: Bivariate vs. multivariate statistics. Remote Sensing, 11(6), 618. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs11060618
#Articulo
#A√±o2019
#leer Wildfire probability; Logistic regression; Evidential belief function; Ensemble modeling; Zagros ecoregion.El estudio compara modelos bivariados (EBF) y multivariados (Regresi√≥n Log√≠stica) para mapear la probabilidad de incendios en Ir√°n. Usando 132 incendios hist√≥ricos y 12 variables explicativas (pendiente, TWI, precipitaci√≥n, NDVI, distancia a carreteras, etc.), se generaron mapas de probabilidad de incendio. El modelo ensemble EBF+LR super√≥ a los individuales (AUC = 0.864 vs. 0.701‚Äì0.728). Los autores recomiendan usar modelos h√≠bridos para mejorar la predicci√≥n en paisajes propensos a incendios. ‚ÄúWildfires dramatically modify the hydrological and mechanical response of slopes, increasing the likelihood of debris-flow initiation.‚Äù ‚ÄúAn improved predictive accuracy (AUC = 0.864) can be achieved via an ensemble modeling of bivariate and multivariate statistics.‚Äù ‚ÄúEnsemble wildfire probability maps take the advantages of both EBF and LR models and significantly improve the ability to predict future wildfires.‚Äù
Este articulo guarda relaci√≥n con Quema de suelos
Fue extra√≠do de las citas de Post Wildifire Stability of Unsaturated Hillslopes Against Rainfall-Triggerred Landslides

Para t√©rminos de organizaci√≥n quiero tener la Bibliograf√≠a dividida en ejes tem√°ticos. Para esto considero el titulo del concepto de tesis presentado en Concepto Tesis de Maestr√≠a El titulo propuesto para mi tesis es "Simulaci√≥n num√©rica de la estabilidad de un talud de un suelo del neis de la iguana afectado por quema aplicando m√©todos probabil√≠sticos." Por tanto relacionare los art√≠culos que tengan los siguientes temas:
Estabilidad de taludes
Quema de suelos o efectos de la quema en suelos

tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/mapa-naci.title: Mapa Nacional de Coberturas de la Tierra 2018 ‚Äì IDEAM
tesis-de-maestria/bibliografia/mapa-naci.description:
#A√±o2018 IDEAM. (2018). Mapa Nacional de Coberturas de la Tierra 2018: Metodolog√≠a CORINE Land Cover adaptada para Colombia. Bogot√°, Colombia: Instituto de Hidrolog√≠a, Meteorolog√≠a y Estudios Ambientales.Coberturas de la tierra; CORINE Land Cover; Colombia; IDEAM; uso del suelo; cobertura vegetal; sistemas productivos; din√°mica antr√≥pica.El documento presenta el Mapa Nacional de Coberturas de la Tierra 2018 elaborado por el IDEAM bajo la metodolog√≠a CORINE Land Cover adaptada para Colombia. Este insumo permite analizar la distribuci√≥n espacial de coberturas naturales y antr√≥picas en todo el territorio nacional, a escala 1:100.000, con base en im√°genes satelitales (Landsat, RapidEye, Sentinel-2) y validaci√≥n de campo.Algunos puntos clave: Se identifican 49 clases de cobertura agrupadas en sistemas como: bosques naturales, matorrales, √°reas agropecuarias, √°reas artificializadas, cuerpos de agua, √°reas desnudas y nevadas. En Colombia, m√°s del 50% del territorio a√∫n es bosque natural, pero con alta presi√≥n de deforestaci√≥n en zonas andinas y amaz√≥nicas. La regi√≥n Andina, donde est√° el Valle de Aburr√°, presenta la mayor fragmentaci√≥n de ecosistemas por urbanizaci√≥n, miner√≠a y expansi√≥n agropecuaria. Para Medell√≠n y alrededores, predominan coberturas urbanas, pastos manejados y relictos de bosque h√∫medo montano. El documento resalta que la informaci√≥n es cr√≠tica para estudios de riesgo, ordenamiento territorial y modelaci√≥n ambiental. ‚ÄúEl Mapa Nacional de Coberturas de la Tierra a escala 1:100.000 constituye una herramienta fundamental para el ordenamiento ambiental del territorio, la planificaci√≥n del uso del suelo y la gesti√≥n del riesgo‚Äù . ‚ÄúLa regi√≥n Andina es la de mayor intervenci√≥n antr√≥pica, con fragmentaci√≥n de los ecosistemas naturales debido al crecimiento urbano, la agricultura intensiva y la miner√≠a‚Äù . ‚ÄúEn el Valle de Aburr√° se identifican coberturas de pastos manejados, mosaicos de pastos y cultivos, √°reas urbanizadas y relictos de bosque h√∫medo montano‚Äù . ‚ÄúLa informaci√≥n de coberturas permite identificar cambios en la cobertura vegetal que pueden aumentar la susceptibilidad a deslizamientos y otros procesos de remoci√≥n en masa‚Äù .
Guarda algo de relaci√≥n con Hidrolog√≠a y lluvias

tesis-de-maestria/core/concepto-tesis-de.title: Concepto Tesis de Maestr√≠a
tesis-de-maestria/core/concepto-tesis-de.description:
#core El titulo propuesto para mi tesis es "Simulaci√≥n num√©rica de la estabilidad de un talud de un suelo del neis de la iguana afectado por quema aplicando m√©todos probabil√≠sticos." Con los siguientes objetivosOBJETIVO GENERAL Evaluar mediante simulaci√≥n num√©rica de elementos finitos, m√©todo de equilibrio limite y an√°lisis estad√≠sticos la incidencia que las condiciones de quema, saturaci√≥n y aumento de la presi√≥n de poros tienen en la estabilidad de un talud.OBJETIVOS ESPEC√çFICOS Determinar mediante ensayos de laboratorio la variaci√≥n en las propiedades √≠ndice, par√°metros de resistencia e hidr√°ulicos de un suelo despu√©s de ser sometido a quema. Simular num√©ricamente escenarios de talud natural y quemado bajo distintas condiciones de saturaci√≥n y lluvia. Comparar los factores de seguridad obtenidos para determinar el impacto de la quema en diferentes escenarios.
Para esto debo organizar la Bibliograf√≠a

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.
